segments.en: Hello English learners.
segments.cn: 你好，英语学习者。

segments.en: Welcome back to another great lesson at EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 欢迎回到EnglishPod的另一堂精彩课程。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: And my name's Erica.
segments.cn: 我叫Erica。

segments.en: And today we're going to be building something.
segments.cn: 今天我们要建造一些东西。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: We've got a lesson about construction.
segments.cn: 我们有一节关于建筑的课程。

segments.en: Cool, so we're going to be working at a construction site today and we're going to learn a lot of cool vocabulary with different types of tools.
segments.cn: 很酷，所以今天我们将在一个建筑工地工作，并学习很多关于不同工具的酷词汇。

segments.en: And we'll also learn some phrases that you can use to talk about work.
segments.cn: 我们还会学习一些可以用来谈论工作的短语。

segments.en: So even if you're not really interested in building, and making stuff with your hands, you will learn some language to talk about work in general.
segments.cn: 所以即使你对建筑和动手制作东西不太感兴趣，你也会学到一些关于工作的语言。

segments.en: All right, so before we get started with this construction dialogue, let's take a look at vocabulary preview.
segments.cn: 好的，在我们开始这个建筑对话之前，让我们先看看词汇预览。

segments.en: Well, Marco, we're going to look at two words now.
segments.cn: 好吧，Marco，我们现在要看两个词。

segments.en: And like you said, we're building something in this lesson, right?
segments.cn: 就像你说的，我们在这节课上要建造一些东西，对吧？

segments.en: Right, we're going to be building a deck.
segments.cn: 对，我们要建一个平台。

segments.en: A deck?
segments.cn: 平台？

segments.en: A deck.
segments.cn: 一个平台。

segments.en: All right, so a deck.
segments.cn: 好的，所以一个平台。

segments.en: What is that?
segments.cn: 那是什么？

segments.en: Basically, it's an elevated wooden platform that houses will have, like in their backyards, maybe.
segments.cn: 基本上，它是一个高架木平台，房子会有，比如在后院。

segments.en: So it's a platform that's a little bit higher off the ground behind your house.
segments.cn: 所以它是一个离地面稍高的后院平台。

segments.en: So it's very popular for houses to have decks, and people will put out a table and chairs and maybe have lunch out there or barbecue or something.
segments.cn: 所以房子有平台是很流行的，人们会在上面放桌子和椅子，可能在那儿吃午餐或烧烤。

segments.en: Okay, so a deck.
segments.cn: 好的，所以一个平台。

segments.en: Now they're building this deck, and they need to follow some plans.
segments.cn: 现在他们正在建这个平台，他们需要遵循一些计划。

segments.en: Plans.
segments.cn: 计划。

segments.en: Plans.
segments.cn: 计划。

segments.en: The plans that we're talking about are construction plans.
segments.cn: 我们所说的计划是建筑计划。

segments.en: Yeah, it's kind of like the map for the deck, how you're going to build it.
segments.cn: 是的，这就像是平台的地图，告诉你如何建造它。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正确。

segments.en: So we can have floor plans, for example.
segments.cn: 所以我们可以有平面图，例如。

segments.en: So that shows you how the building looks, like where the different rooms are.
segments.cn: 这显示了建筑的样子，比如不同房间的位置。

segments.en: And like a house, right?
segments.cn: 就像一栋房子，对吧？

segments.en: So it's basically the map for a construction.
segments.cn: 所以它基本上是建筑的地图。

segments.en: Okay, great.
segments.cn: 好的，很好。

segments.en: So two interesting words.
segments.cn: 所以两个有趣的词。

segments.en: We're going to hear both of these in the dialogue.
segments.cn: 我们将在对话中听到这两个词。

segments.en: Now, why don't we get started and find out what's going to happen as they're building this deck.
segments.cn: 现在，我们开始吧，看看他们在建这个平台时会发生什么。

segments.en: All right, ladies and gentlemen, we've been hired to build a deck on this here house and turn this boring and drab lawn into a backyard oasis.
segments.cn: 好的，女士们先生们，我们被雇来在这栋房子上建一个平台，把这个无聊的草坪变成一个后院绿洲。

segments.en: There is one catch, though.
segments.cn: 不过有一个条件。

segments.en: We've only got one day to finish this.
segments.cn: 我们只有一天的时间来完成这个。

segments.en: So I'm going to need everyone to give 110% today.
segments.cn: 所以我需要大家今天全力以赴。

segments.en: It's going to be tough, but we've got a great team here, and I know that together we can tackle this project.
segments.cn: 这会很艰难，但我们有一个很棒的团队，我知道我们可以一起完成这个项目。

segments.en: That being said, let's get to work.
segments.cn: 话虽如此，让我们开始工作。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Now remember, we've been over the plans, but we really need to make sure that everything is up to code.
segments.cn: 现在记住，我们已经过了计划，但我们真的需要确保一切符合规范。

segments.en: The home inspectors here are pretty thorough, so please make sure you follow the plans exactly.
segments.cn: 这里的房屋检查员非常仔细，所以请确保严格遵循计划。

segments.en: And remember the carpenter's rule of thumb.
segments.cn: 还记得木匠的经验法则。

segments.en: Measure twice, cut once.
segments.cn: 测量两次，切割一次。

segments.en: Okay, guys, let's get at it.
segments.cn: 好吧，大家，开始吧。

segments.en: Bob, pass me that hammer.
segments.cn: Bob，把那个锤子递给我。

segments.en: The nails won't go in.
segments.cn: 钉子打不进去。

segments.en: The wood is too hard.
segments.cn: 木头太硬了。

segments.en: I think I'm going to need the nail gun.
segments.cn: 我想我需要钉枪。

segments.en: That did it.
segments.cn: 成功了。

segments.en: Hey, do me a favor and help me cut this two by four, will ya?
segments.cn: 嘿，帮我把这根两乘四的木头切一下，好吗？

segments.en: Pass me that circle saw and grab hold of the end of the board.
segments.cn: 把那个圆锯递给我，抓住木板的一端。

segments.en: Now help me drill some holes in it so we can place the bolts.
segments.cn: 现在帮我在上面钻一些孔，以便我们可以放置螺栓。

segments.en: I think you should sand the edges.
segments.cn: 我觉得你应该打磨一下边缘。

segments.en: Look at all these splinters.
segments.cn: 看看这些木刺。

segments.en: Someone could get hurt.
segments.cn: 有人可能会受伤。

segments.en: Geez, you've got to take pride in your work.
segments.cn: 天哪，你得对你的工作感到自豪。

segments.en: Yeah, you're right.
segments.cn: 是的，你说得对。

segments.en: Pass me the sander and I'll take care of it.
segments.cn: 把砂光机递给我，我来处理。

segments.en: Julia, get over here with that level measuring tape and that box of screws.
segments.cn: Julia，过来拿那个水平尺和那盒螺丝。

segments.en: Oh no, look out below.
segments.cn: 哦不，小心下面。

segments.en: All right, so there are a lot of people building the deck.
segments.cn: 好的，所以有很多人在建这个平台。

segments.en: They have to build it fast.
segments.cn: 他们必须快速建造。

segments.en: They've only got one day, so it's a really big challenge, huh?
segments.cn: 他们只有一天的时间，所以这是一个很大的挑战，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, and I think this is a good lesson in maybe not rushing through important projects, right?
segments.cn: 是的，我觉得这是一个很好的教训，也许不要急于完成重要项目，对吧？

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So we saw some really interesting tools that they were using.
segments.cn: 所以我们看到了一些他们使用的非常有趣的工具。

segments.en: So why don't we look at that first in language takeaway?
segments.cn: 那么我们为什么不先在语言收获中看看呢？

segments.en: Language takeaway.
segments.cn: 语言收获。

segments.en: All right, so we've got some language all about tools.
segments.cn: 好的，所以我们有一些关于工具的语言。

segments.en: So why don't we just get started?
segments.cn: 那么我们为什么不开始呢？

segments.en: So they mentioned a nail gun.
segments.cn: 他们提到了钉枪。

segments.en: Nail gun.
segments.cn: 钉枪。

segments.en: A nail gun.
segments.cn: 一把钉枪。

segments.en: So we all know about hammers and nails, right?
segments.cn: 所以我们都知道锤子和钉子，对吧？

segments.en: So the nails are what you put in the wood.
segments.cn: 钉子是你放在木头里的东西。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: Now this is an advanced tool, so you don't have to use a hammer.
segments.cn: 现在这是一个高级工具，所以你不需要使用锤子。

segments.en: It's kind of hard to explain, so why don't we listen to the sound this tool makes?
segments.cn: 这有点难以解释，所以我们不如听听这个工具发出的声音？

segments.en: Well, I guess like its name suggests, it's a gun for putting nails in wood.
segments.cn: 嗯，我想就像它的名字所暗示的那样，它是一个用来把钉子打入木头的枪。

segments.en: Yeah, it actually uses compressed air to push nails really fast into the wood.
segments.cn: 是的，它实际上使用压缩空气将钉子非常快速地打入木头。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: All right, so they are nailing some pieces of wood together, but they also needed to cut the wood, and they said, help me cut the two by four.
segments.cn: 好的，所以他们正在把一些木头钉在一起，但他们也需要切割木头，他们说，帮我切这根两乘四的木头。

segments.en: Yeah, she said help me cut this two by four.
segments.cn: 是的，她说帮我切这根两乘四的木头。

segments.en: So a two by four.
segments.cn: 所以一根两乘四的木头。

segments.en: This is a very popular type of wood that you use in construction.
segments.cn: 这是一种在建筑中非常常见的木材。

segments.en: A two by four is basically two inches by four inches.
segments.cn: 一根两乘四的木头基本上是两英寸乘四英寸。

segments.en: So two inches high and four inches wide.
segments.cn: 所以高两英寸，宽四英寸。

segments.en: So it's the most popular and common type of wood that you would use for construction.
segments.cn: 所以这是你在建筑中最常用的木材。

segments.en: A two by four.
segments.cn: 一根两乘四的木头。

segments.en: You'll hear it all the time.
segments.cn: 你会经常听到它。

segments.en: So they're going to cut the two by four, and she said, pass me the circular saw.
segments.cn: 所以他们要切这根两乘四的木头，她说，把圆锯递给我。

segments.en: A circular saw.
segments.cn: 圆锯。

segments.en: A circular saw.
segments.cn: 一把圆锯。

segments.en: So a saw, we understand, is something you use to cut wood.
segments.cn: 所以锯子，我们理解，是用来切割木头的东西。

segments.en: But you have many types of saws.
segments.cn: 但你有很多种锯子。

segments.en: You have a band saw, you have a circular saw, and this one makes this sound.
segments.cn: 你有带锯，你有圆锯，这个发出这个声音。

segments.en: So I guess it's called a circular saw because the blade, or the cutting part, is shaped in a circle.
segments.cn: 所以我想它叫圆锯是因为刀片或切割部分是圆形的。

segments.en: Yeah, a circular saw.
segments.cn: 是的，圆锯。

segments.en: So after they cut the piece of wood, one of the guys said, I think you should sand the edges.
segments.cn: 所以在他们切完木头后，有一个人说，我觉得你应该打磨边缘。

segments.en: To sand something.
segments.cn: 打磨某物。

segments.en: Alright, so if you want to sand usually a piece of wood, you want to use paper covered in sand to make it very smooth.
segments.cn: 好的，如果你想打磨一块木头，通常你会用砂纸来使其非常光滑。

segments.en: Yeah, exactly.
segments.cn: 是的，正是如此。

segments.en: And so they also mentioned a sander, right?
segments.cn: 他们还提到了一种打磨机，对吧？

segments.en: A sander is basically a machine that has this sandpaper on it and will do the hard work for you.
segments.cn: 打磨机基本上是一种机器，上面有砂纸，可以为你完成艰苦的工作。

segments.en: Alright, so to sand something and a sander.
segments.cn: 好的，所以打磨某物和打磨机。

segments.en: Now our next word is very related to sanding something, because if you don't sand a piece of wood, it might have splinters.
segments.cn: 现在我们的下一个词与打磨某物非常相关，因为如果你不打磨一块木头，它可能会有木刺。

segments.en: Splinters.
segments.cn: 木刺。

segments.en: Splinter.
segments.cn: 木刺。

segments.en: Splinters.
segments.cn: 木刺。

segments.en: So like I said, if you cut a piece of wood, there are little pieces of wood that stick out and you can get hurt.
segments.cn: 就像我说的，如果你切了一块木头，会有小木片突出，你可能会受伤。

segments.en: They can get under your skin.
segments.cn: 它们可能会刺入你的皮肤。

segments.en: Yeah, so tiny, tiny parts of wood.
segments.cn: 是的，非常小的木片。

segments.en: That's called a splinter.
segments.cn: 这叫做木刺。

segments.en: A splinter.
segments.cn: 木刺。

segments.en: Okay, so why don't we go on to our next tool.
segments.cn: 好的，那我们为什么不继续下一个工具呢。

segments.en: They were talking about a level.
segments.cn: 他们在谈论水平仪。

segments.en: A level.
segments.cn: 水平仪。

segments.en: The level.
segments.cn: 水平仪。

segments.en: Alright, so this is a tool that all carpenters have.
segments.cn: 好的，这是所有木匠都有的工具。

segments.en: And it's basically a tool that has a little bit of water in it, right?
segments.cn: 基本上是一个里面有一点水的工具，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, and it helps you make sure that everything is straight and flat.
segments.cn: 是的，它帮助你确保一切都是直的和平的。

segments.en: Exactly, so that's a level every carpenter has it.
segments.cn: 正是如此，所以每个木匠都有一个水平仪。

segments.en: And also a measuring tape.
segments.cn: 还有卷尺。

segments.en: A measuring tape.
segments.cn: 卷尺。

segments.en: Measuring tape.
segments.cn: 卷尺。

segments.en: Now I'm sure if this was a video podcast, we could show you what a measuring tape was and you'd really understand it.
segments.cn: 现在我相信如果这是一个视频播客，我们可以给你展示卷尺是什么，你会真正理解它。

segments.en: We'll do our best to describe it for you.
segments.cn: 我们会尽力为你描述它。

segments.en: So a measuring tape is like a ruler that rolls up.
segments.cn: 所以卷尺就像一个可以卷起来的尺子。

segments.en: Yeah, it's a very convenient ruler because it can roll up and you can measure something that is maybe six feet or three meters long.
segments.cn: 是的，它是一个非常方便的尺子，因为它可以卷起来，你可以测量可能六英尺或三米长的东西。

segments.en: And you can extend it and when you're done measuring, you can put it back and just put it in your pocket.
segments.cn: 你可以伸展它，测量完后可以收回去，放进你的口袋里。

segments.en: Yeah, every carpenter has one.
segments.cn: 是的，每个木匠都有一个。

segments.en: A measuring tape.
segments.cn: 卷尺。

segments.en: Alright, so that's our last tool that we're going to talk about.
segments.cn: 好的，这就是我们要谈论的最后一个工具。

segments.en: So why don't we move on now to Fluency Boater where we've got some phrases that you can use to talk about work.
segments.cn: 那我们现在为什么不转到流利构建者，那里有一些你可以用来谈论工作的短语呢。

segments.en: Fluency builder.
segments.cn: 流利构建者。

segments.en: So when the contractor started giving them instructions, he said, I need everyone to give 110% today.
segments.cn: 所以当承包商开始给他们指示时，他说，我需要每个人今天都付出110%。

segments.en: To give 110%.
So when you give 110%, you are basically trying very hard.
segments.cn: 所以当你付出110%时，你基本上是在非常努力地工作。

segments.en: Yeah, you give everything you have to your job.
segments.cn: 是的，你把所有的精力都投入到工作中。

segments.en: Right, so it's not only 100%, it's 110 more than what's needed.
segments.cn: 对，所以不仅仅是100%，而是比所需的多出110%。

segments.en: So no lunch break.
segments.cn: 所以没有午休。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So as they were talking about the instructions, one of the guys said, the carpenter's rule of thumb.
segments.cn: 所以当他们在谈论指示时，有一个人说，木匠的经验法则。

segments.en: A rule of thumb.
segments.cn: 经验法则。

segments.en: So this is an interesting phrase, rule of thumb.
segments.cn: 这是一个有趣的短语，经验法则。

segments.en: What does that mean exactly?
segments.cn: 这到底是什么意思？

segments.en: Okay, well, you know what?
segments.cn: 好吧，你知道吗？

segments.en: I think we can understand the meaning pretty clearly if we listen to some examples.
segments.cn: 我想如果我们听一些例子，我们可以清楚地理解这个意思。

segments.en: Example one.
segments.cn: 例子一。

segments.en: The rule of thumb in making a sale is confidence.
segments.cn: 成交的经验法则是自信。

segments.en: Without confidence, you don't make a sale.
segments.cn: 没有自信，你就无法成交。

segments.en: Example two.
segments.cn: 例子二。

segments.en: The tailor's rule of thumb is twice the circumference of the wrist is the circumference of the neck.
segments.cn: 裁缝的经验法则是手腕的周长是脖子的周长的两倍。

segments.en: Example three.
segments.cn: 例子三。

segments.en: You don't have to take everything I say about marketing as a rule of thumb.
segments.cn: 你不必把我说的关于市场营销的所有内容都当作经验法则。

segments.en: One of the guys noticed a few problems, you know, the splinters.
segments.cn: 有一个人注意到了一些问题，你知道，木刺。

segments.en: And he said, you've got to take pride in your work.
segments.cn: 他就说，你必须为你的工作感到自豪。

segments.en: Okay, so to take pride in your work.
segments.cn: 好的，所以为你的工作感到自豪。

segments.en: To take pride in your work.
segments.cn: 为你的工作感到自豪。

segments.en: Why did he say that to her?
segments.cn: 他为什么对她这么说？

segments.en: What is he trying to tell her?
segments.cn: 他想告诉她什么？

segments.en: Well, because she made some mistakes, she didn't do such a good job.
segments.cn: 好吧，因为她犯了一些错误，她的工作做得不好。

segments.en: He's wanting her to work harder, work better, work more carefully.
segments.cn: 他希望她更加努力，更加认真，更加小心。

segments.en: Okay, and so she can be proud of her work and say this is a job well done.
segments.cn: 好的，这样她就可以为自己的工作感到自豪，并说这是一个出色的工作。

segments.en: So when you take pride in your work, you work so well and do such a good job that you feel really happy about it.
segments.cn: 所以当你为你的工作感到自豪时，你的工作做得很好，做得出色，你会感到非常高兴。

segments.en: All right, good.
segments.cn: 好的，好的。

segments.en: So why don't we listen to this dialogue again for the last time?
segments.cn: 那我们为什么不再听一次这个对话呢？

segments.en: And then we'll come back and talk about construction.
segments.cn: 然后我们再回来谈谈建筑。

segments.en: All right, ladies and gentlemen, we've been hired to build a deck on this here house and turn this boring and drab lawn into a backyard oasis.
segments.cn: 好的，女士们先生们，我们被雇来在这栋房子上建一个平台，把这个无聊的草坪变成一个后院绿洲。

segments.en: There is one catch though.
segments.cn: 不过有一个条件。

segments.en: We've only got one day to finish this.
segments.cn: 我们只有一天的时间来完成这个。

segments.en: So I'm going to need everyone to give 110% today.
segments.cn: 所以我需要每个人今天都付出110%。

segments.en: It's going to be tough, but we've got a great team here.
segments.cn: 这会很艰难，但我们有一个很棒的团队在这里。

segments.en: And I know that together we can tackle this project.
segments.cn: 我知道我们可以一起完成这个项目。

segments.en: That being said, let's get to work.
segments.cn: 话虽如此，让我们开始工作。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Now, remember, we've been over the plans, but we really need to make sure that everything is up to code.
segments.cn: 现在，记住，我们已经过了计划，但我们真的需要确保一切都符合规范。

segments.en: The home inspectors here are pretty thorough.
segments.cn: 这里的房屋检查员非常仔细。

segments.en: So please make sure you follow the plans exactly.
segments.cn: 所以请确保你严格按照计划进行。

segments.en: And remember the carpenter's rule of thumb, measure twice, cut once.
segments.cn: 记住木匠的经验法则，量两次，切一次。

segments.en: Okay, guys, let's get at it.
segments.cn: 好的，伙计们，让我们开始吧。

segments.en: Bob, pass me that hammer.
segments.cn: 鲍勃，把那把锤子递给我。

segments.en: The nails won't go in.
segments.cn: 钉子打不进去。

segments.en: The wood is too hard.
segments.cn: 木头太硬了。

segments.en: I think I'm going to need the nail gun.
segments.cn: 我想我需要钉枪。

segments.en: That did it.
segments.cn: 这样就行了。

segments.en: Hey, do me a favor and help me cut this two by four, will ya?
segments.cn: 嘿，帮我把这根两乘四的木头切一下，好吗？

segments.en: Pass me that circle saw and grab hold of the end of the board.
segments.cn: 把那把圆锯递给我，抓住木板的另一端。

segments.en: Now help me drill some holes in it so we can place the bolts.
segments.cn: 现在帮我在上面钻一些孔，以便我们可以放置螺栓。

segments.en: I think you should sand the edges.
segments.cn: 我觉得你应该打磨边缘。

segments.en: Look at all these splinters.
segments.cn: 看看这些木刺。

segments.en: Someone could get hurt.
segments.cn: 有人可能会受伤。

segments.en: Geez, you got to take pride in your work.
segments.cn: 天哪，你得为你的工作感到自豪。

segments.en: Yeah, you're right.
segments.cn: 是的，你说得对。

segments.en: Pass me the sander and I'll take care of it.
segments.cn: 把砂光机递给我，我来处理。

segments.en: Julia, get over here with that level measuring tape and that box of screws.
segments.cn: 朱莉亚，过来拿那个水平尺和那盒螺丝。

segments.en: Oh no, look out below.
segments.cn: 哦不，小心下面。

segments.en: So an interesting aspect of North American culture is projects like this, right?
segments.cn: 所以北美文化的一个有趣方面就是像这样的项目，对吧？

segments.en: Building a deck or maybe adding a room to your house.
segments.cn: 建一个甲板或者给你的房子加个房间。

segments.en: Yeah, that's right.
segments.cn: 是的，没错。

segments.en: And we call this DIY.
segments.cn: 我们称之为DIY。

segments.en: Right, DIY, do it yourself.
segments.cn: 对，DIY，自己动手。

segments.en: So it's a very popular summer project, right?
segments.cn: 所以这是一个非常受欢迎的夏季项目，对吧？

segments.en: Right, so if you live in a neighborhood in North America, you might see like, you know, the dad of a family outside building something and all his friends come over and they, you know, drink beer and build this big thing together.
segments.cn: 对，如果你住在北美的一个社区，你可能会看到一个家庭的爸爸在外面建东西，他的朋友们过来，一起喝啤酒，建这个大东西。

segments.en: Right, so it could be a tree house, it could be a deck, it could even maybe be adding another room to the house.
segments.cn: 对，这可能是一个树屋，可能是一个甲板，甚至可能是给房子加一个房间。

segments.en: Yeah, and you know, it's actually so popular that there are tons of TV shows about how to build stuff for your house and there are a lot of really big stores where you can go and find like all of this equipment for building stuff for your house.
segments.cn: 是的，你知道，这实际上是如此受欢迎，以至于有很多关于如何为你的房子建东西的电视节目，还有很多大型商店，你可以去那里找到所有的建筑设备。

segments.en: Right, so basically there are these big stores where you can get anything from paint to wood to tools, huge amount of material so you can do it yourself.
segments.cn: 对，基本上有这些大型商店，你可以从油漆到木材到工具，获取大量材料，这样你就可以自己动手。

segments.en: You can DIY.
segments.cn: 你可以DIY。

segments.en: All right, so that's all the time we have for today, but let us know what you think and tell us if you are into doing handy work like this, like maybe building a tree house or building a deck.
segments.cn: 好吧，今天的时间就到这里，但告诉我们你的想法，告诉我们你是否喜欢做这样的手工活，比如建一个树屋或甲板。

segments.en: That's right, you can come to our website at EnglishPod.com and tell us about it.
segments.cn: 没错，你可以访问我们的网站 EnglishPod.com，告诉我们你的想法。

segments.en: As well, you can also leave your questions there.
segments.cn: 另外，你也可以在那里留下你的问题。

segments.en: All right, so we'll see you guys there and until next time.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们下次见。

segments.en: Thanks for listening and goodbye.
segments.cn: 感谢收听，再见。
